snippet: Leaders of the Russian Orthodox Church say protecting Syria’s Christians means supporting the rule of Bashar al-Assad. It’s a position the government cannot ignore.
abstract: Russian Orthodox Church is putting pressure on Russia's Pres Vladimir V Putin to oppose outside intervention in Syria, fearing that Christian minorities in the country will be swept away by a wave of Islamic fundamentalism if Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad is forced from power.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of the Russian Orthodox Church say protecting Syria’s Christians means supporting the rule of Bashar al-Assad. It’s a position the government cannot ignore.

headline.main: Russian Church Is a Strong Voice Opposing Intervention in Syria
headline.print_headline: Russian Church Is a Strong Voice Opposing Intervention in Syria
